description:
doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html: correct "C" comment to mention #cgo

Also fix invalid apostrophe characters.

messages.text:
Hello r (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=6b2ffd34cc40 ***

doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html: correct "C" comment to mention #cgo

Also fix invalid apostrophe characters.

R=r, gri, adg
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058

PTAL http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html File doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode81 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:81: if your program uses any //export directives, then the C code may only On 2012/03/22 23:08:58, r wrote: > on the //export Done. http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode88 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:88: linker for the C parts of the package. The //export directives are On 2012/03/22 23:08:58, r wrote: > ditto Done. http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode90 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:90: in the cgo documentation. On 2012/03/22 23:08:58, r wrote: > things are a bit scrambled. can you reorder so the //export stuff is together? Rearranged text.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html File doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode81 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:81: if your program uses any //export directives, then the C code may only on the //export http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode88 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:88: linker for the C parts of the package. The //export directives are ditto http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/4/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode90 doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:90: in the cgo documentation. things are a bit scrambled. can you reorder so the //export stuff is together?

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/1/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html
File doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/1/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode80
doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:80: statement, but they can be any C code.
i remember a complaint on the mailing list that you shouldn't declare variables in these blocks.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/1/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html
File doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/1/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode80
doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:80: statement, but they can be any C code.
On 2012/03/22 21:35:04, r wrote:
> i remember a complaint on the mailing list that you shouldn't declare variables
> in these blocks.

You cannot declare variables or functions in those blocks if you use //export lines. That fact, and //export in general, are probably worth calling out in this document.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/1002/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html
File doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/1002/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode79
doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:79: the package.  In this case those lines are just a single #include
<code> the #XXX pieces.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5874058/diff/1002/doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html#newcode87
doc/articles/c_go_cgo.html:87: directives, then the C code may only include declarations
which C code?

PTAL

Done.
